items.sentence: I hope you've got some proof to back up your allegations.
The mattress was too soft for me to sleep on comfortably.
The mattress was too hard for me to sleep on comfortably.
For breakfast, I had two eggs and a burnt piece of toast.
Why didn't you tell me that you didn't understand French?
More than eight thousand people took part in the studies.
The gate is so narrow that the car can't pass through it.
The baseball game was canceled because of the heavy rain.
I took a taxi so that I'd be in time for the appointment.
Tom said that Mary was going to go to Boston to see John.
Stop complaining. I'm only doing what you asked me to do.
I hope that Tom doesn't do what he says he's going to do.
Tom bought a house in the village where his in-laws live.
Tom was on his way to school when he was bitten by a dog.
Tom cleared the snow from the driveway with a snowblower.
Tom is concerned about Mary's physical and mental health.
I wonder whether or not Tom stayed in Boston last summer.
I wonder whether or not Tom thinks Mary needs to do that.
A law without a penalty is like a bell without a knocker.
You should've asked Tom for permission before doing that.
What happened here three months ago was truly horrifying.
How do you know you're not mistaking me for someone else?
How do you know you aren't mistaking me for someone else?
It seems strange that Tom didn't want to dance with Mary.
It had nothing to do with the subject we were discussing.
Tom was about to leave when somebody knocked on his door.
It seems like an interesting job. What exactly do you do?
Tom told me he thought Mary still wanted to go to Boston.
Tom told me he thought Mary still wanted to learn French.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was from Australia.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary could speak French.
Tom didn't deny he was the one who stole Mary's necklace.
I think that there's a possibility that Tom will do that.
Tom knew there was a possibility that Mary would do that.
Tom knew there was a possibility Mary would show up late.
Tom knew that there was a possibility Mary would do that.
Do you think there's any chance Tom will be able to come?
What're the chances Tom will tell me what I want to know?
I don't think that Tom would ever do something like that.
Tom told me that he didn't actually want to go to Boston.
Tom denied Mary was the one who persuaded him to do that.
Tom told me he thought that Mary was hesitant to do that.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary would be terrified.
I loved studying French when I was in junior high school.
Whenever I go abroad, I suffer from jet lag and diarrhea.
I don't think I would have ever said what you say I said.
Everybody else at the party was a lot drunker than I was.
Although Tom would never admit it, he's a little jealous.
I know that you and Tom snuck away from school yesterday.
I knew that Tom wouldn't want to go to Australia with me.
